conbody.p: The Plant Application Docker requires SSL security certificates as Trusted Root Certificates.

When installing the Plant Applications Universal Client Docker, you are prompted to generate new certificates, import certificates, or use legacy certificates. If you do not have a certificate, you will typically generate a new one. You can follow the instructions at technet.microsoft.com to create a self-signed certificate for testing in an intranet environment.

Additionally, you are prompted to import the following certificates while logging into the Apache CouchDB and UAA servers:
uaa_server.crt
uaa_server.pem
uaa_server.key
couch_cert_crt.crt
It is mandatory to have your certificates these certificate names only.
